programmes.show_description: Anna Vincenzo's: Gordon Ramsay visits Italian restaurant Anna Vincenzo's in Florida, where owner CeCe has lost her way in the kitchen. But can she take constructive criticism?
...Ross Edgley: Ross's epic Iceland swim enters the freezing Arctic Circle. Between rescuing whales from jellyfish and suffering rotting wounds, Ross falls badly behind schedule. (Ep2/3)
(2019) Adults-only coming-of-age drama about Sequin, a gay 16-year-old who becomes obsessed with a stranger at a party. Starring Conor Leach.
Some extra brunch as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show.
Phil Spencer helps three friends who are searching for a London pad, while Kirstie Allsopp helps newly-weds Daniel and Jennie to find a marital home in north London.
The remaining potters create floral posies and vases, and take on a surprise embellishing challenge. Who'll bloom into the next round, and whose posy isn't all rosy?
Another chance to watch yesterday's new episode, with Chris Packham in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.
Ma Always Liked You Best: Cliff makes a stand for independence by insisting that his visiting mother stays at Woody's place, but he feels left out when they hit it off.
Grease: Norm launches a campaign to save the Hungry Heifer restaurant from closure. Rebecca worries about Robin's welfare.
Breaking In Is Hard to Do: Frasier and Lilith try to spend more time with their son. Carla helps Rebecca plan how to break into jail to pay Robin a conjugal visit.
The Wallpaper: Ray finally snaps when Marie drives her car into his house, and Debra is forced to act as peacemaker.
Meant to Be: Torn between his girlfriend Amy, his ex-wife Joanne and Italian bombshell Stefania, Robert foolishly decides to tell Amy that he met up with Joanne.
Pet Cemetery: When Ray accidentally kills Ally's hamster, Debra insists that the family hold a pet funeral.
Breaking the Ice: When Frasier realises he's never heard his father say 'I love you' to him, he decides to crash his dad's fishing trip with Niles for some father-son bonding.
An Affair to Forget: Frasier gets a call from a woman who believes her husband, a fencing instructor, is having an affair. It's odd that Maris is now passionate about fencing...
Agents in America, Part III: Frasier learns some important new lessons and tactics in the fine art of contract negotiations from his agent Bebe.
The Innkeepers: When Frasier learns that one of Seattle's most famous restaurants is about to close, he visits to say goodbye and, in a moment of madness, offers to buy it.
Rocket Man: Mike and Frank make a scene when they hit the streets in a one-of-a-kind rocket car. But will the massive price tag send them crashing back down to earth?
Channel 4's midday news summary.
Porsche 911 Targa: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Oxfordshire to renovate a rundown 1973 Porsche 911 Targa for Ben, who's had it for 35 years.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: It's a tank-off as Henry Cole turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit in Oxfordshire, while Simon O'Brien transforms some old tanks into a pizza oven in Liverpool.
Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Chris Packham in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.
Ben Hillman helps Lisa and Neil fulfil their dream of buying a holiday home on the Costa Cálida to share with their children. With a budget of £100k, can they find the perfect place?

programmes.show_name: A New Life in the Sun
programmes.show_description: The new series continues. Money worries creep in for Sam and James. Storm damage threatens to scupper Roni's retreat in Portugal. And in Bulgaria, Franky and Mark reach burnout.
The new series continues. In a flurry to the finish line, the bespoke bedrooms are completed. And Max drops a dramatic twist ahead of the final that could change everything. (Ep19/20)

programmes.show_name: New: A Place in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Shirley and Ken see what Famagusta has to offer for £175k, from a 'hard no' non-starter to two perfect places that have them moving in already. How will they pick between two dream homes?
A special edition of Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
Sophie uproots her life to fulfil her dream of transforming the Sheffield house that her grandparents lived in for over 50 years.
Weakened by the Iraq war, Blair's forced out of office by his own party. Blair seeks to build a new legacy on a global scale but is repeatedly forced to defend his time in Number 10. (Ep3)

programmes.show_name: New: Cecil: The Lion and the...
programmes.show_description: ...Dentist: The life and death of Cecil, Africa's biggest lion - whose killing by a wealthy American dentist and hunter in 2015 went viral, causing global outrage at a slaughter for sport.
Random Acts shows some of the world's best films. What happens next after domestic abuse? Nicola Stead's film tells the story of a mother who fled, found her voice, and fought for justice.
In Nottingham, staff at Queen's Medical Centre deal with a crime wave of needle-spiking attacks on female university students, including Kate, who collapsed at a nightclub.
Mama Rita's: Gordon tries to bring new ideas to Mama Rita's Mexican restaurant in Newbury Park, southern California.
(2018) Drama. Lukas Dhont's debut feature stars Victor Polster as a teenage trans ballet dancer whose profession puts unimaginable strain on her body. In French/Flemish/subs.

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: It's a Cullercoats catch-up, as we see how Mark and Suze are getting on after transforming their topsy-turvy townhouse. Do they still have the renovation bug?
In Manchester, Kirstie and Phil help two young first-time buyers who've both agreed to share the home-buying decision-making with their new tenants.
Another chance to watch yesterday's new episode, with Chris Packham in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.
Bad Neighbor Sam: Sam gets into a feud with John Hill - the snobbish new owner of the restaurant above the bar - when he makes demands about the staff and property.
Veggie-Boyd: Woody gets a part in a TV advert for a healthy vegetable drink but is upset to discover that he doesn't like the product. Sam introduces trivia napkins at the bar.
Norm and Cliff's Excellent Adventure: Woody gets hooked on buying rubbish from a home shopping channel. Norm and Cliff start a fight between Sam and Frasier over a credit card.
The Author: Ray has to face up to failure for once, while Robert is promoted to lieutenant, causing the brothers to fall out.
The Walk to the Door: Ray feels guilty when he meets a woman he dated 25 years earlier and treated badly. He decides to apologise but soon regrets bringing up the past.
Young Girl: Robert is dating a 22-year-old woman. Debra and Marie think he's being foolish, but Ray and Frank aren't so sure. But is she really 22?
Dark Victory: After counselling his family and friends when all he wants is a little peace, Frasier comes to realise that sometimes you have to put others first.
She's the Boss: Frasier and the new station boss get on like oil and water - especially when she moves his show to 2am.
Shrink Rap: Niles and Frasier decide to enter family therapy in an effort to get on better. Some hope...
Martin Does It His Way: When their least favourite aunt dies, Frasier and Niles are inspired to help Martin make his dream come true: to finish writing a song for Sinatra.
Virginia Is for Pickers: It's a picking blitz in Virginia, as Mike, Frank, Robbie and Danielle all hit the road to leave no lead unturned in a bid to double their income.
Channel 4's midday news summary.
Jeep Grand Cherokee: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head for Somerset to turn former soldier Ben's run-down classic Jeep into an off-roading machine.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk to meet Margaret, an avid collector and former mayor - so they need to be on their best behaviour!
Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Chris Packham in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.
Brian and Rita both have busy lives and can't wait to buy a holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca for relaxing getaways with their family. Jasmine Harman shows them what their £150k can buy.

programmes.show_name: A New Life in the Sun
programmes.show_description: The new series continues. Franky and Mark start renovations at their Bulgarian retreat. In France, Sam and James face a deadline, while Pete and Anna crank up their new business.
The new series concludes. After weeks of challenges, triumphs and breakthroughs, one pair finally win the keys to their French chateau and the life they've always dreamed of. (Ep20/20)

programmes.show_name: New: A Place in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Paul and his daughter Holly see what La Duquesa - at the quieter end of the Costa del Sol - has to offer for £190k. Will a wild card be Paul's perfect place?
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
...the Crisp Factory: It's crunch time, as one of Britain's best-known brands launches its latest crisp flavour. From soil to shelf, tear into the journey of how Walkers' new crisp is born.
The Goggleboxers settle down for more of the biggest and best TV. What do they think this time?
Aisling Bea and Chloe Petts muse over the week's news with Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker.

programmes.show_name: Joe Lycett: I'm About to Lose...
programmes.show_description: ...Control and I Think Joe Lycett: Joe shares jokes, paintings and some trolling he's been up to, such as breaking into banks, selling art for £12.5million and taking on Olympic medallists.
